taxonomicnotes: This species was described from the Mun River, a tributary of the Mekong River in eastern Thailand (Ng 2002). It was misidentified as B. macracanthus in the literature prior to its recognition as a distinct species.
rationale: The species is considered uncommon or seasonal in the Mekong River drainage (Vidthayanon 2008, W. Rainboth pers. comm. 2011), but it is currently unclear whether this represents a natural scarcity or is the result of anthropogenic disturbance. Given our current lack of information concerning the population trends of this species and its vulnerability to anthropogenic disturbance, this species is assessed as Data Deficient.
